name: Will Ainsworth
bio: Will Ainsworth is the 31st Lieutenant Governor of Alabama. A former state representative and small business owner, he has focused on workforce development, economic growth, and education reform. He chairs the Alabama Small Business Commission and the Lieutenant Governor’s Commission on a 21st Century Workforce.
education: Auburn University (BA in Marketing)
endorsements: Alabama Farmers Federation, Business Council of Alabama, Alabama Retail Association
platform: Workforce development, small business growth, education reform, and conservative governance.

platformFollowThrough.Workforce Development: Expanded career tech programs and industry partnerships
platformFollowThrough.Education Reform: Backed school choice and STEM initiatives
platformFollowThrough.Economic Growth: Advocated for infrastructure investment and job creation
platformFollowThrough.Public Safety: Supported law enforcement funding and school safety measures

proposals: Create a statewide apprenticeship network, expand dual enrollment programs, and reduce regulatory burdens for small businesses.
engagement: Active in workforce summits, education forums, and small business roundtables.

SB261 – Small Business Regulatory Reform Act (2022)
HB440 – Career Tech Dual Enrollment Expansion (2023)
SB123 – School Safety and Resource Officer Act (2021)
HB312 – Infrastructure Investment and Job Creation Act (2022)

name: Nancy Dahlstrom
bio: Nancy Dahlstrom is the 15th Lieutenant Governor of Alaska. A former state legislator and corrections commissioner, she has focused on election integrity, public safety, and administrative modernization. She was elected in 2022 alongside Governor Mike Dunleavy.
education: University of Alaska Anchorage (BA, MA in Organizational Management)
endorsements: Alaska Republican Party, Alaska Correctional Officers Association, Alaska Outdoor Council
platform: Election security, public safety, administrative efficiency, and conservative governance.

platformFollowThrough.Public Safety: Supported corrections reform and law enforcement coordination
platformFollowThrough.Administrative Efficiency: Streamlined agency operations and digital services
platformFollowThrough.Veterans Services: Promoted access to benefits and housing programs
platformFollowThrough.Rural Access: Advanced outreach and infrastructure in remote communities

proposals: Expand ballot security measures, improve corrections workforce training, and modernize state service delivery.
engagement: Active in election forums, veterans events, and rural outreach summits.

SB151 – Veterans Housing and Services Expansion Act (2024)
HB89 – Rural Infrastructure and Access Act (2023)

name: Pulu Ae Ae
bio: Pulu Ae Ae is the Lieutenant Governor of American Samoa. Elected in 2024, he serves in a nonpartisan capacity and works alongside the Governor to oversee territorial administration. His focus includes infrastructure, education, and cultural preservation.
platform: Territorial development, education access, cultural heritage, and public health.

platformFollowThrough.Infrastructure: Supported road and utility upgrades across the territory
platformFollowThrough.Education Access: Promoted school modernization and teacher support
platformFollowThrough.Cultural Heritage: Advanced preservation of Samoan language and traditions
platformFollowThrough.Public Health: Backed vaccination campaigns and rural clinic expansion

proposals: Expand vocational training, improve healthcare access, and invest in cultural tourism.
engagement: Active in community forums, education summits, and cultural events.

name: Leslie Rutledge
bio: Leslie Rutledge is the 21st Lieutenant Governor of Arkansas. Formerly the state’s Attorney General, she is the first woman elected to both offices. She has focused on conservative governance, education reform, and economic development. Rutledge is known for her advocacy on parental rights and rural infrastructure.
education: University of Arkansas (BA), University of Arkansas School of Law (JD)
endorsements: Arkansas Farm Bureau, National Rifle Association, Arkansas State Chamber of Commerce
platform: Parental rights, education reform, rural infrastructure, and conservative values.

platformFollowThrough.Parental Rights: Backed legislation affirming parental control over education and healthcare decisions
platformFollowThrough.Education Reform: Supported school choice and vocational training expansion
platformFollowThrough.Economic Development: Promoted small business growth and workforce training
platformFollowThrough.Public Safety: Advocated for law enforcement support and crime prevention

proposals: Expand school choice programs, improve rural broadband access, and strengthen parental rights legislation.
engagement: Active in education forums, rural development summits, and conservative policy conferences.

HB1458 – Vocational Education and Workforce Training Act (2023)

name: Eleni Kounalakis
bio: Eleni Kounalakis is the 50th Lieutenant Governor of California and the first woman elected to the office. A former U.S. Ambassador to Hungary and business executive, she has focused on higher education, climate action, and international trade. She also serves as a University of California regent and California State University trustee.
education: Dartmouth College (BA), UC Berkeley Haas School of Business (MBA)
endorsements: California Democratic Party, EMILY’s List, Sierra Club California
platform: Higher education, climate leadership, economic diplomacy, and equity.

platformFollowThrough.Higher Education: Advocated for affordability and expanded access across UC and CSU systems
platformFollowThrough.Climate Leadership: Promoted clean energy and coastal resilience initiatives
platformFollowThrough.Economic Diplomacy: Led trade missions and international partnerships
platformFollowThrough.Equity: Supported inclusive policy development and civic engagement

proposals: Expand student housing, strengthen climate adaptation programs, and deepen international trade ties.
engagement: Active in education summits, climate forums, and diplomatic outreach events.

name: Dianne Primavera
bio: Dianne Primavera is the 50th Lieutenant Governor of Colorado. A former state legislator and cancer survivor, she also serves as Director of the Office of Saving People Money on Health Care. Her work focuses on health care affordability, disability rights, and aging services.

name: Susan Bysiewicz

name: Jay Collins
bio: Jay Collins is the Lieutenant Governor of Florida. A former Green Beret and state senator, he was appointed in 2025 following the resignation of Jeanette Nuñez. Collins has focused on veterans' issues, public safety, and conservative governance.

endorsements: Florida Republican Party, Veterans for America First, Florida Chamber of Commerce

name: Josh Tenorio
bio: Josh Tenorio is the 10th Lieutenant Governor of Guam and the first openly LGBTQ+ elected official in the territory. A former chief of staff and public safety administrator, he has focused on criminal justice reform, education, and disaster preparedness. He was elected in 2018 alongside Governor Lou Leon Guerrero and re-elected in 2022.
education: University of Guam (BA in Political Science)

platformFollowThrough.Economic Development: Supported workforce training and small business growth
platformFollowThrough.Equity: Led initiatives for inclusive policy and community engagement

proposals: Expand emergency shelter capacity, improve school infrastructure, and promote inclusive hiring practices.

name: Juliana Stratton
bio: Juliana Stratton is the 48th Lieutenant Governor of Illinois and the first Black woman elected to the office. A former state representative and director of the Center for Public Safety and Justice at UIC, she has focused on criminal justice reform, equity, and economic opportunity. She was elected in 2018 alongside Governor J.B. Pritzker and re-elected in 2022.
education: University of Illinois (BA), DePaul University College of Law (JD)
